Niton Trick...
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Niton Trick...
By Azulazulazula on Wednesday, February 29, 2012 - 01:56 pm:

So, before when I tried the "Niton Trick", I could not get it to work for the life of me. Then, I realized that, perhaps if I tried to reswap on "(Checking the CD now...)" instead of "(Reading the Data Now...)", perhaps it would work. And it did. This was ~one year ago. Now, here I am, trying to do it again, swapping on "Checking" and it won't work. What's up?

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, February 29, 2012 - 10:40 pm:

What model PlayStation are you using?

By Azulazulazula on Friday, March 2, 2012 - 03:06 pm:

I honestly have no clue. I can describe it...it's about 1 1/2 inch thick, ten inches wide, about 6 inches deep. Power button is a circle with ~1 inch diameter in the bottom left, same for the open button in the bottom right. The reset button is a circle about 1/2 inch above the power button, and is about 1/4 of an inch diameter. The disc tray rests in the center, with Sony printed at the top, and the PS1 logo about 1 inch below the center of the cover. Two memory card slots rest in the front of the system, with "1" over the one on the left, and "2" over the one on the right. Directly below them are the two controller ports. I feel the back is somewhat irrelevant in the description.

Sorry if that was too in depth...:P

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, March 3, 2012 - 10:14 am:

No that's fine. I was just checking to see if you were using a PS3 or something.

I suspect that there's some sort of precise timing issue involved. I don't think I ever got it to work.
